edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.renderer

Class TemporalRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.renderer.TemporalRenderer

  • public class TemporalRenderer
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    Temporal renderers provide time-based rendering of features in a feature layer. It can be useful to visualize historic or real-time data such as earthquake or hurricane occurances. You can use a temporal renderer to define how observations (regular, historic, latest) and tracks are rendered. You can also show aging of features with respect to the map's time extent.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

      • create

        public static TemporalRenderer create(Renderer observationRenderer,
                      Renderer latestObservationRenderer,
                      Renderer trackRenderer,
                      SymbolAger observationAger)
        Creates a new TemporalRenderer object that can be used with a time-aware feature layer.
        Parameters:
        observationRenderer - - Renderer for regular/historic observations. Required.
        latestObservationRenderer - - Renderer for the most current observations. Optional.
        trackRenderer - - Renderer for the tracks. A track is a collection of events that share a common track ID. A track line is a graphic line that connects the observations. Applicable only for feature layers with a valid trackIdField. Optional.
        observationAger - - Symbol ager for regular observations. Optional.
        Returns:
        TemporalRenderer

      • getSymbol

        Returns the symbol used to render the graphic.
        Parameters:
        graphic - - The input graphic.
        Returns:
        Symbol
